column4: hey guys, i have uninstalled compiz (everytihng was ok) but after a reboot all my bars where away (left bar and top bar)
left bar needs compiz to exist
i have ubuntu 11.04, the left bar was there before i installed compiz
you can log in to gnome classic desktop and you should be ok
compiz is in a default install
so how to i access terminal?
CTRL+ALT+T
i tired that already, doesent work
EGuinn how do i start terminal without ctrl-alt-t
could use CTRL+ALT+F1
thats the black big fullscreen window, i was there before but what should i do there?
its tty, its not a fullscreen window. You can get back with CTRL+ALT+F7
k i could acces ctrl-alt-f1 but when i type something in there they want my password, when i type it in the always say it failed
its your login pass, you won't get any feedback, just keep typing and hit enter
yeah i know that type of login from terminal sudo -i but when i type and press enter it echo bak that the login failed
check caps lock :)
i checked it, negative
not sure then dude
could it be that my pass wa reseted, (i have autologin)
worth dropping to root recovery mode and set the password again
how?
hold shift at boot, select recovery mode, select root
k thx bye
